definition: to be born/arrival of newborn/birth (of a savior or religious leader)
to drop/to fall/to come down/to descend
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student

sentences.english: Many feared the baby could be born in the UnitedStates, making it an American citizen.
sentences.chinese: 很多人擔心寶寶可能會降生在美國，成爲美國公民。

sentences.english: Come adore, on bended knee, Christ the Lord the newborn King.
sentences.chinese: 屈膝跪拜新生王，救主基督今降生。

sentences.english: God sent His Son they called Him Jesus.
Some of the villagers thought Birth had occurred.
sentences.chinese: 有的鄉下佬以爲梵天已經降生。

sentences.english: Jesus my Lord came down to earth.
They welcomed their first child, Suri, into the world on April 18 of this year.
sentences.chinese: 他們在今年4月18日迎來了第一個孩子蘇瑞的降生。

sentences.english: All that summer I ruled the country,and waited for the baby.
sentences.chinese: 整個夏季我治理着這個國家，並等待着孩子的降生。

sentences.english: But the jamie says I continuously in the world without waiting new baby.
sentences.chinese: 而亞紀則說本人不斷在沒有朔的世界等候着朔的降生。

sentences.english: We were born in the same hospital, her the day before me.
sentences.chinese: 我們在同一所醫院裏降生，她比我早出生一天。

sentences.english: From Milton's first major poem, the Nativity Ode.
sentences.chinese: 他第一首重要詩作《降生頌歌》中看出來。

sentences.english: The newborn is the first red panda to be born at the zoo in 15 years.
sentences.chinese: 這隻幼熊是15年來在動物園降生的第一隻紅貓熊。

sentences.english: David will have a niece or nephew this December .
sentences.chinese: 大衛十二月份將有一個小侄女或小侄子降生。

sentences.english: Jack and Mary expect their second very soon.
sentences.chinese: 傑克和瑪麗期待着第二個孩子的降生。
試想飛禽走獸如何降生。

sentences.english: Come and behold Him, Born the King of Angels;
sentences.chinese: 來朝見聖嬰，天使君王降生。

sentences.english: A baby was born, and they named her Deirdre.
sentences.chinese: 他們的愛情結晶降生了，他們給她起名迪爾德麗。

definition: to be born/to come into being/to withdraw from worldly affairs
lit. to descend to earth (of an immortal)/to be born
to become pregnant/to carry a child in the womb
to give birth to/to give rise to
El Niño (meteorology)/Holy Infant (cf biblical nativity story)
reborn (of departed spirit)/to be reincarnated/to leave home for a new life
